page.title: 12Ecology of the Gunton area
page.content: The younger generation of farmers particularly appear to be intensely interested in conservation of the countryside, to the extent that trees and hedgerows recently removed to provide more productive land,are now being replaced.There is a growing awareness of the need to preserve life in the local ponds,woods and other natural habitats.Wild animals,birds and flowers abound in the Gunton Park and its surrounding woodland, a beautiful area, unspoilt by noise or pollution. However,both rabbits and pigeons are a cause for concern to the local farmers, in an area where because of its very nature,control is difficult.Footpaths crossing arable land are indistinct.But for those living in gunton park there are numerous walks and bridle paths.The roads through the park are privately owned and closed to the public.
